section: Gauri - Bhagtah Ki Bani (Teachings Of The Saints)

melody.description: There is no melody or mood associated with this line, which may be because it is the preamble to the hymn, or is not meant to be read in any particular melody or mood

author.author: None
author.description: There is no author associated with this line, as it may be the preamble to the hymn

text: ਗਜ ਨਵ ਗਜ ਦਸ ਗਜ ਇਕੀਸ ਪੁਰੀਆ ਏਕ ਤਨਾਈ ॥
section: Gauri - Bhagtah Ki Bani (Teachings Of The Saints)

translation.text: Nine yards, ten yards, and twenty-one yards - weave these into the full piece of cloth;

transliteration.text: gaj nav gaj das gaj ikīs purīā ēk tanāī .

melody.description: Gauri creates a mood where the listener is encouraged to strive harder in order to achieve an objective. However, the encouragement given by the Raag does not allow the ego to increase. This therefore creates the atmosphere where the listener is encouraged, but still prevented from becoming arrogant and self-important.

author.author: Saint Kabir
author.description:
Saint Kabir [1440 - 1518] was a Muslim mystic born in Varanasi in India, whose 541 hymns are included in the Guru Granth Sahib. His writings about God are full of love and devotion, very direct and striking in appeal.

The birth of Kabir remains to this day shrouded in mystery and legend. Authorities disagree on both when he was born and who his parents were. One legend proclaims a divine virginal birth. His mother was reputed to have been of the Brahman caste and to have become pregnant after a visit to a Hindu shrine.

Because she was unwed, she abandoned Kabir, who was found and adopted by a Muslim weaver. That his early life began as a Muslim there is no doubt, although he later became influenced by the Hindu ascetic, Ramananda, who he accepted as his Guru.

text: ਸਾਠ ਸੂਤ ਨਵ ਖੰਡ ਬਹਤਰਿ ਪਾਟੁ ਲਗੋ ਅਧਿਕਾਈ ॥੧॥
section: Gauri - Bhagtah Ki Bani (Teachings Of The Saints)

translation.text: take the sixty threads and add nine joints to the seventy-two on the loom. ||1||

transliteration.text: sāth sūt nav khand bahatar pāt lagō adhikāī .1.

melody.description: Gauri creates a mood where the listener is encouraged to strive harder in order to achieve an objective. However, the encouragement given by the Raag does not allow the ego to increase. This therefore creates the atmosphere where the listener is encouraged, but still prevented from becoming arrogant and self-important.

section: Gauri - Bhagtah Ki Bani (Teachings Of The Saints)

translation.text: Life weaves itself into its patterns.

melody.description: Gauri creates a mood where the listener is encouraged to strive harder in order to achieve an objective. However, the encouragement given by the Raag does not allow the ego to increase. This therefore creates the atmosphere where the listener is encouraged, but still prevented from becoming arrogant and self-important.

section: Gauri - Bhagtah Ki Bani (Teachings Of The Saints)

translation.text: Leaving her home, the soul goes to the world of the weaver. ||1||Pause||

melody.description: Gauri creates a mood where the listener is encouraged to strive harder in order to achieve an objective. However, the encouragement given by the Raag does not allow the ego to increase. This therefore creates the atmosphere where the listener is encouraged, but still prevented from becoming arrogant and self-important.

text: ਗਜੀ ਨ ਮਿਨੀਐ ਤੋਲਿ ਨ ਤੁਲੀਐ ਪਾਚਨੁ ਸੇਰ ਅਢਾਈ ॥
section: Gauri - Bhagtah Ki Bani (Teachings Of The Saints)

translation.text: This cloth cannot be measured in yards or weighed with weights; its food is two and a half measures.

transliteration.text: gajī n minīai tōl n tulīai pāchan sēr adhāī .

melody.description: Gauri creates a mood where the listener is encouraged to strive harder in order to achieve an objective. However, the encouragement given by the Raag does not allow the ego to increase. This therefore creates the atmosphere where the listener is encouraged, but still prevented from becoming arrogant and self-important.

text: ਜੌ ਕਰਿ ਪਾਚਨੁ ਬੇਗਿ ਨ ਪਾਵੈ ਝਗਰੁ ਕਰੈ ਘਰਹਾਈ ॥੨॥
section: Gauri - Bhagtah Ki Bani (Teachings Of The Saints)

translation.text: If it does not obtain food right away, it quarrels with the master of the house. ||2||

transliteration.text: jau kar pāchan bēg n pāvai jhagar karai gharahāī .2.

melody.description: Gauri creates a mood where the listener is encouraged to strive harder in order to achieve an objective. However, the encouragement given by the Raag does not allow the ego to increase. This therefore creates the atmosphere where the listener is encouraged, but still prevented from becoming arrogant and self-important.

text: ਦਿਨ ਕੀ ਬੈਠ ਖਸਮ ਕੀ ਬਰਕਸ ਇਹ ਬੇਲਾ ਕਤ ਆਈ ॥
section: Gauri - Bhagtah Ki Bani (Teachings Of The Saints)

translation.text: How many days will you sit here, in opposition to your Lord and Master? When will this opportunity come again?

transliteration.text: din kī baith khasam kī barakas ih bēlā kat āī .

melody.description: Gauri creates a mood where the listener is encouraged to strive harder in order to achieve an objective. However, the encouragement given by the Raag does not allow the ego to increase. This therefore creates the atmosphere where the listener is encouraged, but still prevented from becoming arrogant and self-important.

text: ਛੂਟੇ ਕੂੰਡੇ ਭੀਗੈ ਪੁਰੀਆ ਚਲਿਓ ਜੁਲਾਹੋ ਰੀਸਾਈ ॥੩॥
section: Gauri - Bhagtah Ki Bani (Teachings Of The Saints)

translation.text: Leaving his pots and pans, and the bobbins wet with his tears, the weaver soul departs in jealous anger. ||3||

transliteration.text: shūtē kūndē bhīgai purīā chaliō julāhō rīsāī .3.

melody.description: Gauri creates a mood where the listener is encouraged to strive harder in order to achieve an objective. However, the encouragement given by the Raag does not allow the ego to increase. This therefore creates the atmosphere where the listener is encouraged, but still prevented from becoming arrogant and self-important.

text: ਛੋਛੀ ਨਲੀ ਤੰਤੁ ਨਹੀ ਨਿਕਸੈ ਨਤਰ ਰਹੀ ਉਰਝਾਈ ॥
section: Gauri - Bhagtah Ki Bani (Teachings Of The Saints)

translation.text: The wind-pipe is empty now; the thread of the breath does not come out any longer. The thread is tangled; it has run out.

transliteration.text: shōshī nalī tant nahī nikasai natar rahī urajhāī .

melody.description: Gauri creates a mood where the listener is encouraged to strive harder in order to achieve an objective. However, the encouragement given by the Raag does not allow the ego to increase. This therefore creates the atmosphere where the listener is encouraged, but still prevented from becoming arrogant and self-important.

text: ਛੋਡਿ ਪਸਾਰੁ ਈਹਾ ਰਹੁ ਬਪੁਰੀ ਕਹੁ ਕਬੀਰ ਸਮਝਾਈ ॥੪॥੩॥੫੪॥
section: Gauri - Bhagtah Ki Bani (Teachings Of The Saints)

translation.text: So renounce the world of form and substance while you remain here, O poor soul; says Kabeer: you must understand this! ||4||3||54||

transliteration.text: shōd pasār īhā rah bapurī kah kabīr samajhāī .4.3.54.
